title: Tennessee Titans bench Marcus Mariota, turn to Ryan Tannehill vs. Denver Broncos
text:
CLOSE

DENVER — A brutal first-half performance in Denver was the final straw.

The Tennessee Titans on Sunday benched Marcus Mariota in favor of Ryan Tannehill, who entered in the thirdquarter after Mariota threw his second interception of the day.

Mariota completed just seven of 18 passes for 63 yards and two interceptionsagainst the Denver Broncos in their Week 6 matchup. He also was sacked three times – against a Broncos team that entered averaging just one sack a game – as the Titans offense mustered just 81 total yards of offense on 31 plays in the opening 30 minutes.

Mariota had played all but two snaps through the first five weeks of the season; Tannehill was inserted briefly during garbage time against the Browns in Week 1.

Mariota, playing in a contract year in his fifth NFL season, threw an interception late in the second quarter, his first turnover of the season. He entered Week 6 having been sacked a league-high 22 times.

If you love talking football, we have the perfect spot for you. Join our Facebook Group, The Ruling Off the Field, to engage in friendly debate and conversation with fellow football fans and our NFL insiders.
description: Marcus Mariota completed just seven of 18 passes for 63 yards and two interceptions before he was pulled for Ryan Tannehill.
